# Excessive Blocked Traffic Events Generated by User

Creates an incident when a Symantec Endpoint Proection agent detects excessive amounts of blocked traffic generated by a single user.

| Attribute | Value |
|:----------|:------|
| **Type** | Analytic Rule |
| **Solution** | [Symantec Endpoint Protection](../solutions/symantec-endpoint-protection.md) |
| **ID** | `fa0ab69c-7124-4f62-acdd-61017cf6ce89` |
| **Severity** | Medium |
| **Status** | Available |
| **Kind** | Scheduled |
| **Tactics** | Exfiltration, CommandAndControl, LateralMovement |
| **Techniques** | T1041, T1132, T1001, T1021 |
| **Required Connectors** | [SyslogAma](../connectors/syslogama.md) |
| **Source** | [View on GitHub](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/Symantec%20Endpoint%20Protection/Analytic%20Rules/ExcessiveBlockedTrafficGeneratedbyUser.yaml) |

## Tables Used

This content item queries data from the following tables:

- [`Syslog`](../tables/syslog.md)
